metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1639 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
syncevo/installcheck-local.sh in syncevolution before 1.3.99.7 uses mktemp to create a safe temporary file but appends a suffix to the original filename and writes to this new filename, which allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the new filename.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1639` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgdbussyncevo0 - 1.3.99.7-1
libsyncevo-dbus0 - 1.3.99.7-1
libsyncevolution0 - 1.3.99.7-1
sync-ui - 1.3.99.7-1
syncevolution - 1.3.99.7-1
syncevolution-common - 1.3.99.7-1
syncevolution-dbus - 1.3.99.7-1
syncevolution-http - 1.3.99.7-1
syncevolution-libs - 1.3.99.7-1
syncevolution-libs-gnome - 1.3.99.7-1
syncevolution-libs-kde - 1.3.99.7-1
syncevolution-provider-goa - 1.3.99.7-1
syncevolution-provider-uoa - 1.3.99.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: syncevolution package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.99.7-1').
